section.title: Collecting messages from remote hosts using the BSD syslog protocol
section.para: The tcp(), tcp6(), udp(), udp6() drivers can receive syslog messages conforming to RFC3164 from the network using the TCP and UDP networking protocols. The tcp6() and udp6() drivers use the IPv6 network protocol, while tcp() and udp() use IPv4.

procedure.title: Change an old source driver to the network() driver
procedure.para: To replace your existing tcp(), tcp6(), udp(), udp6() sources with a network() source, complete the following steps.

step.para: Replace the driver with network. For example, replace udp( with network(

listitem.para: If you used TLS-encryption, add the transport("tls") option, then continue with the next step.
If you used the tcp or tcp6 driver, add the transport("tcp") option.
If you used the udp or udp driver, add the transport("udp") option.

step.para: If you use IPv6 (that is, the udp6 or tcp6 driver), add the ip-protocol("6") option.

If you did not specify the port used in the old driver, check and verify that your clients send the messages to the default port of the transport protocol you use. Otherwise, set the appropriate port number in your source using the port() option.
All other options are identical. Test your configuration with the syslog-ng --syntax-only command.
